intro: Calycorectes striatulus, commonly known as the striped calycorectes, is a unique member of the family Cucurbitaceae. It is characterized by its striking, striated leaves that exhibit a distinctive pattern of light and dark green. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a round, fleshy berry that ripens to a bright orange color. While it is not widely cultivated, it is of interest to botanists due to its unusual morphology and potential ecological roles.
